messages.subject: Looking for Articles to Publish for Homeschoolers
messages.msgSnippet: Passing this info along. ... public ... credit ... organization, ... for ... about ... rooms. ... interest ... can ... information.
messages.messageBody:
Passing this info along.

> >Hello! For those who don't know me, my name is Lara Kimber and I am
> >the Founder and Leader of the L.L.G. -Lifetime Learners of Georgia
> >Homeschooling Support Group. One thing my group does is put out a
> >Print Newsletter that is free to members and available to the
public
> >for subscription. We are a non-profit group so all proceeds from
> >subscriptions go back to the group and to help keep the newsletter
> >going. All positions are filled on a volunteer basis. We are an
> >inclusive group that does not make any religious or political
> >Philosophy a part of the group's identity. Our newsletter reflects
> >this foundation. I only mention all of this so you know the way the
> >newsletter is handled. :)
> >
> >I am writing today to ask if any of you have any articles you would
> >like to submit, and if so I would love to review them for possible
> >inclusion in our newsletter. You would of course receive full
credit
> >for the article and if you have a website, business, or
organization,

> >this can be a great way to help promote it. Also, you would receive
> >every issue of our newsletter that includes your work so that you
> >will have a hard copy of your published writing.
> >
> >Our goal with this newsletter is to make it an excellent resource
for

> >homeschoolers as well as trying to help the general public learn
about
> >homeschooling. It is also a great resource for *any* parent who is
> >interested in the education of their children. So many who do not
> >know about homeschooling often put it down due to a fear of the
> >unknown. Our newsletter currently goes out to many businesses that
> >are not officially homeschool related (isn't everything homeschool
> >related though?), such as some Chiropractic Clinics, Veterinary
> >Clinics, School Supply Stores, etc. Clinics are putting our
> >newsletter out for their patients to read while in the waiting
rooms.

> >We feel this is a great way to reach many people who might not
> >otherwise know anything about homeschooling.
> >
> >The types of articles I am looking for do not *have* to be directly
> >related to homeschooling. They can be about education or of
interest
> >to parents in general as well.
> >
> >If you have any questions or items you would like to submit, you
can
> >contact me: Lara Kimber at mrslarak@... or
> >kimbers97@...
> >
> >Thank you in advance! :)
> >
> >Lara Kimber
> >President of L.L.G.
> >Editor of the L.L.G. Newsletter
> >
> >=====
> >L.L.G.-Lifetime Learners of Georgia Homeschooling Website:
> >http://llg.freeyellow.com/
> >Offering an eclectic mix of homeschooling resources and
information.
> >Learn about the L.L.G. Homeschooling Support Group while visiting.
> >
